artist: Utagawa Kunisada; Publisher: Iseya Kanekichi; Carver: Yokogawa Takejirō
creditline: Bequest of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
inscription: 秋来ぬと　目にはさやかに　見へねとも　風の音にそ　おとろかれぬる {Aki kinu to / me ni wa sayaka ni / mienedomo / kaze no oto ni zo / odorokare uru} (When autumn came / My eyes clearly / Could not see it, yet / In the sound of the wind / I felt it.)
markings: censor seals: 濱 {Hama} | 馬込 {Magome} | 子九 (Rat 9) | publisher's seal: {Isekane} | carver's seal: 彫竹 {hori Take}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e), ink and color on paper
portfolio: The Visual Parody of the Thirty-Six Selected Poets (Mitate sanjūrokkasen no uchi 見立三十六歌撰之内)
signed: in toshidama cartouche: 豊國画 {Toyokuni ga}
title: Poem by Fujiwara no Toshiyuki Ason: (Actor Ichikawa Kodanji IV as) the Ghost of Kasane
